Game 6: Heat 98, Celtics 79 > Series tied, 3-3

Heat force Game 7

(Elise Amendola/AP)
LeBron James, with 45 points, and Miami owned Game 6, building a lead early and never looking back. The Heat and Celtics will play Game 7 on Saturday . (Globe)

Winter, ex-head of Bulger's Winter Hill Gang, arrested

Howie Winter, 83, the predecessor of gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, was arrested tonight on organized crime- related charges, officials said. (Globe)

Mass. teachers union strikes deal with reform group to curb seniority rights

The union agreed to give up significant seniority rights for members in exchange for an education group's commitment to halt a ballot initiative. (Boston Globe)
  • 1/25 States weaken teacher tenure rights

Chad Ochocinco released

The Patriots released receiver Chad Ochocinco, who reported to Gillette this morning, but then left "in a hurry" a short time later, a league source said. (Boston Globe)

Schilling's 38 Studios files for bankruptcy

Curt Schilling's troubled video game company filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy protection today, clearing the way to liquidate the company. (Boston Globe)

Big Dig pavement
crumbles early

Sections of the Central Artery that were supposed to last 30 years are failing in less than a decade, causing a rash of potholes and debris.

Obama winning among small donors

As of the end of April, 43 percent of the donors who contributed to the Obama campaign gave $200 or less, generating a total of $88.5 million.
Opinion | Bob Ryan

Sweet deal for soda

Massachusetts is one of only 12 states in the country that essentially subsidize soda, forgoing sales taxes to make it cheaper than it should be.

The new service is an improvement over the on-screen channel guide we’ve been using for years, but the effort to empower viewers is a work in progress.
